availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Clark County, Kentucky, farmer, banker, and soldier. Married Pattie N. Poston on November 24, 1857. Farmer in Clark County in 1860. Household owned seven enslaved persons in 1860. 1st Lieutenant and Quartermaster in the 16th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.), from September 1862 to January 1863.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 2, p. 69. Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 926. Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 295. Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records Microfilm rolls #994027-994058 (Frankfort: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives). Find A Grave, "Dr Wiley Taul Poynter (1838-1896)," Memorial #100783027, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/100783027# (accessed on July 13, 2018).
